A dangerous, murderous Frost-Wyrm is a great offering to the Gods indeed, and none are more dangerous and murderous than Frigustrex, Scion of the Cold-Void. It appears only where the worst snow storms fall, so to hunt it down you must battle the worst of the elements as well as the monster itself.
Hunt down and slay the deadly Frost-Wyrm known as Frigustrex, Scion of the Cold-Void

While all War Hydras can live to be incredibly ancient, legend has it that the Beast of Raema is all but immortal and will never die of old age. The older it gets, the larger it grows; its scales denser, its teeth get sharper and claws longer. The legends that recount this creature's attacks say that its mere presence has a mesmeric effect on those caught in its gaze; they are driven mad by the motion of the creature as it sways and intertwines its long necks. Until now, the beast has remained in the far north of Naggarond, feeding off lone Dark Elf settlements and other wandering creatures that stray into its path, but what would happen if it ventured beyond its usual hunting grounds?
Hunt down and slay the savage Beast of Raema!

Clan Gritus have become so successful in preying on weakling clans that in recent years they have amassed a surplus of wealth. The clan's chieftains have traded chests filled with Warpstone and commissioned the Master Moulders of Hell Pit to create a hideous creature of unparalleled size and ferocity: the Hellbeast of Seep-Gore. This monster is said to be in constant pain, for within its abdomen exists a whole other colony...
Hunt down and slay the foul Hellbeast of Seep-Gore!

Perhaps the scariest of all giant humanoid monster species, Cygors are some of the angriest creatures to roam the Old World. The Salzenmund Soul-Eaters are a pair of Cygors even bigger and stronger than others of their kind, making them among the most difficult monsters to hunt. Their cycloptic eyes not only see the Winds of Magic, but also dampen their use for most spellcasters in their presence.
Hunt down and slay the gargantuan Cygors known as the Salzenmund Soul-Eaters

As creatures of Chaos, Dragon Ogre Shaggoths are a highly-favourable sacrifice to the Dark Gods, but also extremely difficult to bring down. Their strength and power are proportional to their age, making the millennia-old Traygard Mountain-Cleaver in particular a truly-challenging target for the hunt. Beware the lightning!
Hunt down and slay the colossal Shaggoth known as Traygard Mountain-Cleaver

Arachnarok Queens are the type of despicable poisonous monster that should not be trifled with. One Venom Queen is hard enough to bring down, but to take on this bounty you will have to face multiple Queens – the Brood Queens of Karak Azul. All in a day’s hunt!
Hunt down and slay the venomous Brood Queens of Karak Azul

Blorgar the Mad Titan is a brutish and highly flatulent Giant wreaking havoc in the Grey Mountains. As his name suggests, he has no real agenda except to mindlessly trample settlements and squish their inhabitants under his colossal wart-ridden feet. The Dark Gods may favour such an unpredictable and destructive being, but they shall surely favour you more for slaying it in their name!
Hunt down and slay the belligerent Giant known as Blorgar the Mad Titan

Somewhere amongst the lush glades of Athel Loren lives Radixashen, Serpent of the Worldroots. Although the Wood Elves are highly adept at protecting their territory, when the forest is in real peril this mighty Forest Dragon will come to their aid. It is a terrific bounty, but in sacrificing it you will be depriving the forest of one of its champions - it will not be given up easily!
Hunt down and slay the elusive Forest Dragon known as Radixashen, Serpent of the World Roots

A great prize awaits the hunter who dares brave the most desolate reaches of the northern tundra. One particular herd of mammoths known as the Great Mawherd of Bloodfjord has earned notoriety throughout the tribes for having the most powerful and unpredictably aggressive beasts in its parade. Slaying them will surely bring great favour!
Hunt down and slay the mighty mammoths of the Great Mawherd of Bloodfjord

The Abyssal Shrieker is a terrible flying beast of legend, shrouded in macabre myth. This nightmare of the sky, whose shrieks of the damned emanate from the Ruinous Realm itself, is of the giant Undead bat species known as Terrorgheists. Little is known about the Abyssal Shrieker, except that many a hunter has fallen trying to fell it!
Hunt down and slay the ghastly Terrorgheist known as the Abyssal Shrieker

As a Flamespyre Phoenix ages, its body cools, and even begins to sap heat from its surroundings. Not so the Mother of the Flame - this gigantic Phoenix has never cooled and burns as brightly now as when she was first born, within the heart of a volcano. The Mother is said to spend much of her life within the Realm of Chaos itself, gliding upon the Winds of Magic and hunting Daemonic essence. When she does enter the mortal world she emerges from an erupting volcano, bringing purifying fire into the world, often accompanied by her flaming children.
Hunt down and slay the deadly Mother of the Flame!

While the most infamous Carnosaur is Grymloq - mount of the mighty Kroq-Gar - there is another known to the Skinks of the Hexoatl isthmus. A Carnosaur like no other; a creature than can never be tamed and blessed with an eternal hunger that has seen it grow to a massive size. The Lizardmen call it 'Gargantulzan' - a behemoth of the Old Ones - and worship it as a minor god. As a deity, Gargantulzan is worthy of many sacrifices. The jungle provides a vast bounty, but the Skinks will also gladly gift their hungry god any warmbloods foolish to stray too close.
Hunt down and slay the behemoth Gargantulzan!
